DOC.brief_title: Epidural Volume Extension Intrathecal Use Local Anesthetics Cesarean Sections
DOC.detailed_description: Parturients schedule elective caesarean section randomly allocate 6 group : receive double-blindly intrathecal isobaric bupivacaine 10 mg ( Group B ) , ropivacaine 15mg ( Group R ) , levobupivacaine 10mg ( Group L ) combine 10 μg fentanyl follow epidural administration 10 ml N/S 0,9 % respectively , isobaric bupivacaine 10 mg ( Group BupivacaineF ) , ropivacaine 15mg ( Group RopivacaineF ) , levobupivacaine 10mg ( Group LevobupivacaineF ) combine 10 μg fentanyl without epidural administration 10 ml N/S 0,9 % . Clinical endpoint sensory motor block profile , haemodynamics ( arterial pressure , heart rate ) side effect .
DOC.criteria: Elective cesarean section ASA III complicate pregnancy ( i.e preeclampsia , eclampsia , arterial hypertension , diabetes mellitus ) abnormal fetal heart rate time admission body mass index > 35 kg/m2 height < 150cm > 185 cm age < 18 yr > 40 yr patient contraindication spinal anaesthesia ( i.e anticoagulant ) ASA > III intraoperative excessive bleeding patient previous psychiatric disease
